--- Nate Ledbetter <ltdomer98@...> wrote:

Now, if you want to start quoting Stephen
Hayes
(Explanation: I'm currently putting myself through the
agony of reading his book--and I use that term only
because it has pages and is bound--about the mystical
origins of Ninjutsu--insert appropriate oohs and ahs
here.

Years ago, when I was working in a bookstore in L.A., I knew some fellows
studying with Frank Dux as well as some studying with Stephen Hayes.  As I
was certain that Dux was a fraud (a very fast, legitimately deadly fraud,
with some frighteningly effective moves, but still nothing like the adopted
son of an Old Ninja Family that he pretended to be), I called up Hayes at
his studio and asked him something about research.  I was thinking about
getting the store to stock some of his books.  I have rarely made anyone so
nervous in a first conversation.  It set off my internal alarms, and I never
did order the books.
	Gereg
P.S.  Ooh.  Ah.  (Almost forgot that.)
